comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content:
This is just below Headley Tarn, with the cliffs above Blue Lake visible in the background.

Grazing in the high country was carried out for about a century.  It was banned in the late 1950s - early 1960s.  It has taken many decades for the Alpine environment to recover from the damage done by the hard hooves of cattle

comment.author: 50615476@N03
comment._content: No, this is below Club Lake [named Harnetts Lake in Kerry's slides] and Carruthers Peak.
